position: Founder’s Office at Elucidata | D.E. Shaw | SRCC

positions.subtitle: Connecting Dreams Foundation-SRCC Chapter
positions.description: -Spearheaded a 60-member team selected out of 600+ applicants to devise a financially sustainable model from idea to growth stage to revive the art of double-fired terracotta pottery after surveying 600+ potters in India’s largest potter’s colony-Managed end to end operations of the project viz. need analysis, community engagement, supply chain management and business development-Partnered with 4 designers to modify 30+ products incorporating modern tastes and displayed the products at 12 exhibitions & 6 retail outlets-Built the 1st online marketplace by listings on 20+ platforms (15 E-Commerce & 5 Social Media) generating a revenue of 2.7 Lakh in just 4 months of inception with 600+ happy clients by creating 8 entrepreneurs in 3 states & increasing their income by 285%; creating medial impressions of 3.5 M-Co-headed the online crowdfunding campaign of 2.5 lakh rupees, achieving 67% of the target within 48 hours of launch for the project-Project Recognition: Ministry of Culture, Ministry of Textile, HT City (2.72 M) and 104.8 FM (5.3 L), Dream Project of the Year among 100+ projects-Business Plan Competitions: Winner at 5, among top 3 at 5 and campus finalist in 18 national and international level business plan competitions
positions.title: Founder, Project Rivaayat
positions.description_html:
-Spearheaded a 60-member team selected out of 600+ applicants to devise a financially sustainable model from idea to growth stage to revive the art of double-fired terracotta pottery after surveying 600+ potters in India’s largest potter’s colony

-Managed end to end operations of the project viz. need analysis, community engagement, supply chain management and business development

-Partnered with 4 designers to modify 30+ products incorporating modern tastes and displayed the products at 12 exhibitions & 6 retail outlets

-Built the 1st online marketplace by listings on 20+ platforms (15 E-Commerce & 5 Social Media) generating a revenue of 2.7 Lakh in just 4 months of inception with 600+ happy clients by creating 8 entrepreneurs in 3 states & increasing their income by 285%; creating medial impressions of 3.5 M

-Co-headed the online crowdfunding campaign of 2.5 lakh rupees, achieving 67% of the target within 48 hours of launch for the project

-Project Recognition: Ministry of Culture, Ministry of Textile, HT City (2.72 M) and 104.8 FM (5.3 L), Dream Project of the Year among 100+ projects

-Business Plan Competitions: Winner at 5, among top 3 at 5 and campus finalist in 18 national and international level business plan competitions

positions.subtitle: Connecting Dreams Foundation-SRCC Chapter
positions.description: -Initiated 8+ capability building sessions to refine skillset of the team; Analyzed 8 sectors to devise 10 business models-Designed a sanitation model to end open defecation leading to potential revenue of 5 lakh, benefitting 1500+ people in 3 urban slums

experience.title: Delegate
experience.description: •1 among 11 students selected to represent SRCC for a week-long collaborative program between SRCC, Miranda House and Utrecht Business School, Netherlands on SDG-10 'Reducing Inequalities' focusing on inclusion in among countries, including those related to representation, migration and development assistance•Winner of Inclusive Marketing Challenge presented on Maybelline Foundation in context of India

experience.title: Participant and Representative
experience.description: •1 among the 12 selected to represent SRCC at 4 educational institutions involving interactive sessions at the Indian Embassy and UNDP covering SDGs 3,4 & 13 emphasizing contributions made by the youth in UN Agenda 2030•Co-authored a research paper on ‘Quality Education’ based on primary research of 100+ students in Nepal about the contemporary trends of higher education and reservation policies to be presented in the Nepal Consulate in India

projects: [{"title":"Aarogya","start_date":"Jul 2018","end_date":"May 2019","description":"•Established a low-cost supply chain to ensure regular availability of good quality sanitary napkins in Shastri Park by empowering women, leading to a 485% increase in their income by making 8000 pads available at 50% lower than the market price under CDF, SRCC•Conducted 50+ ‘nukkad nataks’ and health camps to create menstrual health awareness impacting 2500+ women •Titled as the ‘Padman of Delhi’ by HT City and gained the medial impression of 2.72 M•Recognised as the ‘Most Popular Project’ amongst 40+ projects by Connecting Dreams Foundation India 2018-19"},{"title":"Arpan","start_date":"Jul 2018","end_date":"May 2019","description":"•Empowered 8 underprivileged women in village Ranhola under CDF, SRCC by involving them in the manufacturing and packaging of low smoke incense sticks to curb micro level pollution, increasing their income by 275% and generating a 12% profit in the very first cycle•Maneuvered a technical collaboration with Ess Kay Enterprises as well as established 35+ selling points across NCR"}]
